io.leonis.zosma.game.data

Interface PlayerCommand

  • All Superinterfaces:
    java.io.Serializable
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AddPlayerCommand, AveragePlayerCommand, LimitPlayerCommand, MultiplyPlayerCommand, PlayerCommand.State

    public interface PlayerCommand
extends java.io.Serializable
    The Interface PlayerCommand. This interface describes the functionality of a command which is issued to an agent.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      static class  PlayerCommand.State 

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static PlayerCommand STOP
      This command will stop the robot.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      float getChipKick()
      Desired chip kick distance in meters.
      float getDribblerSpin()
      Desired dribbler spin, from -1 to +1, where -1 is the maximum reverse-spin that can be imparted to the ball, and +1 is the maximum forward-spin that can be imparted to the ball.
      float getFlatKick()
      If this field is empty then no flat kick command should be sent.
      float getVelocityR() 
      float getVelocityX() 
      float getVelocityY() 

    • Field Detail

      • STOP

        static final PlayerCommand STOP
        This command will stop the robot.

    • Method Detail

      • getVelocityX

        float getVelocityX()
        Returns:
        Desired forward drive velocity in mm per second.

      • getVelocityY

        float getVelocityY()
        Returns:
        Desired sideways left drive velocity in mm per second.

      • getVelocityR

        float getVelocityR()
        Returns:
        Desired counter-clockwise angular velocity in radians per second.

      • getFlatKick

        float getFlatKick()
        If this field is empty then no flat kick command should be sent.
        Returns:
        Desired flat kick speed, in meters per second.

      • getChipKick

        float getChipKick()
        Desired chip kick distance in meters. If this field is missing then no flat kick command should be sent. If this field is present along with the flat_kick field then the flat_kick command takes precedence.
        Returns:
        Desired chip kick distance in meters.

      • getDribblerSpin

        float getDribblerSpin()
        Desired dribbler spin, from -1 to +1, where -1 is the maximum reverse-spin that can be imparted to the ball, and +1 is the maximum forward-spin that can be imparted to the ball.
        Returns:
        Desired dribbler spin, from -1 to +1.
